column2: any herbaceous plant having medicinal properties

column2: a victory (as in a race or other competition); "he was happy to get the win"

column9: a written symbol that is used to represent speech; "the Greek alphabet has 24 characters"

column4: be subject to change in accordance with a variable; "Prices vary"; "His moods vary depending on the weather"
column5: make something more diverse and varied; "Vary the menu"

column2: a facial expression characterized by turning up the corners of the mouth; usually shows pleasure or amusement
(usually preceded by `in') a detail or point; "it differs in that respect"
column3: the condition of being honored (esteemed or respected or well regarded); "it is held in esteem"; "a man who has earned high regard"
column4: an attitude of admiration or esteem; "she lost all respect for him"
column5: a courteous expression (by word or deed) of esteem or regard; "his deference to her wishes was very flattering"; "be sure to give my respects to the dean"
column6: behavior intended to please your parents; "their children were never very strong on obedience"; "he went to law school out of respect for his father's wishes"
column7: a feeling of friendship and esteem; "she mistook his manly regard for love"; "he inspires respect"
column8: courteous regard for people's feelings; "in deference to your wishes"; "out of respect for his privacy"

column2: a male with the same parents as someone else; "my brother still lives with our parents"
column3: a male person who is a fellow member (of a fraternity or religion or other group); "none of his brothers would betray him"
column4: a close friend who accompanies his buddies in their activities
column5: used as a term of address for those male persons engaged in the same movement; "Greetings, comrade!"
column6: (Roman Catholic Church) a title given to a monk and used as form of address; "a Benedictine Brother"

column2: an investigation of the component parts of a whole and their relations in making up the whole
column3: the abstract separation of a whole into its constituent parts in order to study the parts and their relations
column4: a form of literary criticism in which the structure of a piece of writing is analyzed
column5: the use of closed-class words instead of inflections: e.g., `the father of the bride' instead of `the bride's father'
column6: a branch of mathematics involving calculus and the theory of limits; sequences and series and integration and differentiation
column7: a set of techniques for exploring underlying motives and a method of treating various mental disorders; based on the theories of Sigmund Freud; "his physician recommended psychoanalysis"

column2: the time yet to come
column3: a verb tense that expresses actions or states in the future
column4: bulk commodities bought or sold at an agreed price for delivery at a specified future date

column2: an abstract idea of that which is due to a person or governmental body by law or tradition or nature; "they are endowed by their Creator with certain unalienable Rights"; "Certain rights can never be granted to the government but must be kept in the hands of the people"- Eleanor Roosevelt; "a right is not something that somebody gives you; it is something that nobody can take away"
column3: location near or direction toward the right side; i.e. the side to the south when a person or object faces east; "he stood on the right"
column4: the piece of ground in the outfield on the catcher's right
column5: those who support political or social or economic conservatism; those who believe that things are better left unchanged
column6: the hand that is on the right side of the body; "he writes with his right hand but pitches with his left"; "hit him with quick rights to the body"
column7: a turn toward the side of the body that is on the south when the person is facing east; "take a right at the corner"
column8: anything in accord with principles of justice; "he feels he is in the right"; "the rightfulness of his claim"
column9: (frequently plural) the interest possessed by law or custom in some intangible thing; "mineral rights"; "film rights"

column2: food for domestic livestock
an extended communication (often interactive) dealing with some particular topic; "the book contains an excellent discussion of modal logic"; "his treatment of the race question is badly biased"
column3: an exchange of views on some topic; "we had a good discussion"; "we had a word or two about it"

column2: the whole amount
column3: a quantity obtained by the addition of a group of numbers

column2: a distinct part that can be specified separately in a group of things that could be enumerated on a list; "he noticed an item in the New York Times"; "she had several items on her shopping list"; "the main point on the agenda was taken up first"
column3: a small part that can be considered separately from the whole; "it was perfect in all details"
column4: a whole individual unit; especially when included in a list or collection; "they reduced the price on many items"
column5: an isolated fact that is considered separately from the whole; "several of the details are similar"; "a point of information"
column6: an individual instance of a type of symbol; "the word`error' contains three tokens of `r'"

column2: a power to affect persons or events especially power based on prestige etc; "used her parents' influence to get the job"
column3: causing something without any direct or apparent effort
column4: a cognitive factor that tends to have an effect on what you do; "her wishes had a great influence on his thinking"
column5: the effect of one thing (or person) on another; "the influence of mechanical action"
column6: one having power to influence another; "she was the most important influence in my life"; "he was a bad influence on the children"

column2: the condition of being free; the power to act or speak or think without externally imposed restraints
column3: immunity from an obligation or duty

column2: a prearranged meeting for consultation or exchange of information or discussion (especially one with a formal agenda)
column3: an association of sports teams that organizes matches for its members
column4: a discussion among participants who have an agreed (serious) topic

column2: a statute in draft before it becomes law; "they held a public hearing on the bill"
column3: an itemized statement of money owed for goods shipped or services rendered; "he paid his bill and left"; "send me an account of what I owe"
column4: a piece of paper money (especially one issued by a central bank); "he peeled off five one-thousand-zloty notes"
column5: the entertainment offered at a public presentation
column6: an advertisement (usually printed on a page or in a leaflet) intended for wide distribution; "he mailed the circular to all subscribers"
column7: a sign posted in a public place as an advertisement; "a poster advertised the coming attractions"
column8: a list of particulars (as a playbill or bill of fare)
column9: a long-handled saw with a curved blade; "he used a bill to prune branches off of the tree"
column10: a brim that projects to the front to shade the eyes; "he pulled down the bill of his cap and trudged ahead"
column11: horny projecting mouth of a bird

column2: a special group delegated to consider some matter; "a committee is a group that keeps minutes and loses hours" - Milton Berle
column3: a fee for services rendered based on a percentage of an amount received or collected or agreed to be paid (as distinguished from a salary); "he works on commission"
column4: the act of granting authority to undertake certain functions
column5: the state of being in good working order and ready for operation; "put the ships into commission"; "the motor was out of commission"
column6: a group of representatives or delegates
column7: a formal statement of a command or injunction to do something; "the judge's charge to the jury"
column8: an official document issued by a government and conferring on the recipient the rank of an officer in the armed forces
column9: the act of committing a crime
column10: a special assignment that is given to a person or group; "a confidential mission to London"; "his charge was deliver a message"

column2: an assertion of a right (as to money or property); "his claim asked for damages"
column3: an assertion that something is true or factual; "his claim that he was innocent"; "evidence contradicted the government's claims"
column4: demand for something as rightful or due; "they struck in support of their claim for a shorter work day"
column5: an informal right to something; "his claim on her attentions"; "his title to fame"
column6: an established or recognized right; "a strong legal claim to the property"; "he had no documents confirming his title to his father's estate"; "he staked his claim"
column7: a demand especially in the phrase "the call of duty"

column2: the final match between the winners of all previous matches in an elimination tournament
column3: an examination administered at the end of an academic term

column2: the property of being physically or mentally strong; "fatigue sapped his strength"
column3: capability in terms of personnel and materiel that affect the capacity to fight a war; "we faced an army of great strength"; "politicians have neglected our military posture"
column4: physical energy or intensity; "he hit with all the force he could muster"; "it was destroyed by the strength of the gale"; "a government has not the vitality and forcefulness of a living man"
column5: an asset of special worth or utility; "cooking is his forte"
column6: the power to induce the taking of a course of action or the embracing of a point of view by means of argument or entreaty; "the strength of his argument settled the matter"
column7: the amount of energy transmitted (as by acoustic or electromagnetic radiation); "he adjusted the intensity of the sound"; "they measured the station's signal strength"
column8: capacity to produce strong physiological or chemical effects; "the toxin's potency"; "the strength of the drinks"
column9: the condition of financial success; "the strength of the company's stock in recent weeks"
column10: permanence by virtue of the power to resist stress or force; "they advertised the durability of their products"

column2: a new branch
column3: the act of shooting at targets; "they hold a shoot every weekend during the summer"

column2: an effort that is inconvenient; "I went to a lot of trouble"; "he won without any trouble"; "had difficulty walking"; "finished the test only with great difficulty"
column3: a factor causing trouble in achieving a positive result or tending to produce a negative result; "serious difficulties were encountered in obtaining a pure reagent"
column4: a condition or state of affairs almost beyond one's ability to deal with and requiring great effort to bear or overcome; "grappling with financial difficulties"
column5: the quality of being difficult; "they agreed about the difficulty of the climb"

column2: an event that accomplishes its intended purpose; "let's call heads a success and tails a failure"; "the election was a remarkable success for the Whigs"
column3: an attainment that is successful; "his success in the marathon was unexpected"; "his new play was a great success"
column4: a state of prosperity or fame; "he is enjoying great success"; "he does not consider wealth synonymous with success"
column5: a person with a record of successes; "his son would never be the achiever that his father was"; "only winners need apply"; "if you want to be a success you have to dress like a success"

column2: the extended spatial location of something; "the farming regions of France"; "religions in all parts of the world"; "regions of outer space"
column3: a part of an animal that has a special function or is supplied by a given artery or nerve; "in the abdominal region"
column4: a large indefinite location on the surface of the Earth; "penguins inhabit the polar regions"
column5: the approximate amount of something (usually used prepositionally as in `in the region of'); "it was going to take in the region of two or three months to finish the job"; "the price is in the neighborhood of $100"
column6: a knowledge domain that you are interested in or are communicating about; "it was a limited realm of discourse"; "here we enter the region of opinion"; "the realm of the occult"

column2: a thing constructed; a complex entity constructed of many parts; "the structure consisted of a series of arches"; "she wore her hair in an amazing construction of whirls and ribbons"

column5: a particular complex anatomical part of a living thing; "he has good bone structure"
column6: the people in a society considered as a system organized by a characteristic pattern of relationships; "the social organization of England and America is very different"; "sociologists have studied the changing structure of the family"

column2: to consider or examine in speech or writing; "The author talks about the different aspects of this question"; "The class discussed Dante's `Inferno'"
column3: speak with others about (something); talk (something) over in detail; have a discussion; "We discussed our household budget"

column2: producing or capable of producing an intended result or having a striking effect; "an air-cooled motor was more effective than a witch's broomstick for rapid long-distance transportation"-LewisMumford; "effective teaching methods"; "effective steps toward peace"; "made an effective entrance"; "his complaint proved to be effectual in bringing action"; "an efficacious law"
column3: able to accomplish a purpose; functioning effectively; "people who will do nothing unless they get something out of it for themselves are often highly effective persons..."-G.B.Shaw; "effective personnel"; "an efficient secretary"; "the efficient cause of the revolution"
column4: works well as a means or remedy; "an effective reprimand"; "a lotion that is effective in cases of prickly heat"
column5: exerting force or influence; "the law is effective immediately"; "a warranty good for two years"; "the law is already in effect (or in force)"
column6: existing in fact; not theoretical; real; "a decline in the effective demand"; "confused increased equipment and expenditure with the quantity of effective work done"
column7: ready for service; "the fort was held by about 100 effective soldiers"

column2: a number or letter indicating quality (especially of a student's performance); "she made good marks in algebra"; "grade A milk"; "what was your score on your homework?"

column6: the impression created by doing something unusual or extraordinary that people notice and remember; "it was in London that he made his mark"; "he left an indelible mark on the American theater"
column7: a symbol of disgrace or infamy; "And the Lord set a mark upon Cain"--Genesis
column8: formerly the basic unit of money in Germany
column9: Apostle and companion of Saint Peter; assumed to be the author of the second Gospel
column10: a person who is gullible and easy to take advantage of
column11: a written or printed symbol (as for punctuation); "his answer was just a punctuation mark"

column13: the shortest of the four Gospels in the New Testament
column14: an indication of damage
column15: a marking that consists of lines that cross each other
column16: something that exactly succeeds in achieving its goal; "the new advertising campaign was a bell ringer"; "scored a bull's eye"; "hit the mark"; "the president's speech was a home run"

column6: the large room of a manor or castle

column7: make known to the public information that was previously known only to a few people or that was meant to be kept a secret; "The auction house would not disclose the price at which the van Gogh had sold"; "The actress won't reveal how old she is"; "bring out the truth"; "he broke the news to her"; "unwrap the evidence in the murder case"
column8: see for the first time; make a discovery; "Who discovered the North Pole?"
column9: identify as in botany or biology, for example

column2: a powerful effect or influence; "the force of his eloquence easily persuaded them"

column4: physical energy or intensity; "he hit with all the force he could muster"; "it was destroyed by the strength of the gale"; "a government has not the vitality and forcefulness of a living man"

column10: (of a law) having legal validity; "the law is still in effect"

column2: (of actions or states) slightly short of or not quite accomplished; all but; "the job is (just) about done"; "the baby was almost asleep when the alarm sounded"; "we're almost finished"; "the car all but ran her down"; "he nearly fainted"; "talked for nigh onto 2 hours"; "the recording is well-nigh perfect"; "virtually all the parties signed the contract"; "I was near exhausted by the run"; "most everyone agrees"
column3: in a close manner; "the two phenomena are intimately connected"; "the person most nearly concerned"

column4: a venture at something new or different; "as an experiment he decided to grow a beard"

column5: an association of companies for some definite purpose
column6: any communal combination of funds; "everyone contributed to the pool"

column10: any of various games played on a pool table having 6 pockets

column3: of great consequence; "marriage is a serious matter"

column5: appealing to the mind; "good music"; "a serious book"
column6: completely lacking in playfulness
column7: requiring effort or concentration; complex and not easy to answer or solve; "raised serious objections to the proposal"; "the plan has a serious flaw"

column4: money to support a worthy person or cause
column5: the work of providing treatment for or attending to someone or something; "no medical care was required"; "the old car needs constant attention"
